annotation: Maria Bethânia, irmã de Caetano, encomendou a composição e pediu que a música contivesse esses dizeres como o último verso

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Baby, baby
 I love you
 Baby, baby
annotation: Gal Costa’s voice here is a final representation of how relaxed the song is suppose to make you feel.
Sarcastic/ironic remark about the need to learn English in order to “be somebody”

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Você precisa tomar um sorvete
 Na lanchonete
annotation:
You have to have ice cream
At the cafeteria

This line like many others throughout the song seems to reference the upper class lifestyle in almost a parodic form.

Listen to the song by Roberto Carlos

It doesn’t reference a specific song but the way people talked, for example: “Have you heard that new Roberto Carlos song?”

Roberto Carlos is considered one of the most influential artists in Brazil during the 1960s, being cited as a source of inspiration by many artists and bands up to the 1980s. He was called the king and was often a topic of conversation.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Não sei, comigo vai tudo azul
 Contigo vai tudo em paz
annotation: I know with me comes everything blue, with you comes everything in peace.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Vivemos na melhor cidade
 Da América do Sul
 Da América do Sul
annotation: We live in the best city in South America. – This line is referring to Rio de Janeiro.
I know that’s the way it is
You have to know more about me

sections.explanation: First verse introduces themes of personal freedom and introspection.
Second verse delves into cultural ironies and humor.
Climactic part of the song with more dynamic vocals.
Outro where the mood calms again, focusing on personal connections.

song_start.explanation: The song begins softly with gentle instrumentation.

song_end.explanation: The song closes on a tender note.
